intro: Corpuscularia britteniae, commonly known as the brittleleaf corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, colorful flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
